userestrict.head: Publication Rights:
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Carnochan Family Papers, M849, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: SCOPE AND CONTENT
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Carnochan, Morris, Farnham, Lambard, Baldwin, and Bliss family papers and ephemera. Included are correspondence, documents (including commissions, maps, wills, bank statements, and receipts), printed material including bound genealogies and memorials, and photographs.

1 letter A.M. to M.A.M. Mar. 4, 1857

To J.M.C. dated Dec. 10, 1856
Madame Schubert was governess to the Carnochan children; 8 letters, 1 postcard from various people, many sending thanks for the care of their children. Several in Russian

1 letter T.L. to S.F. Lambard Aug. 25, 1879

3 letters, n.d. S.L.B. to sister C.L. Armitage

This sub-series is a facsimile of the "Farnham Album," a collection of Farnham family letters, genealogies, poems, etc. dating from 1745-1845. The originals are held by the Massachusetts Historical Society.

did.unittitle: Introductory letter from John Farnham June 28, 1833,genealogies, and an account of the collection of album by Charlotte Farnham Leonard (1850.)
Undated and miscellaneous items in Farnham album.

scopecontent.p: Contains letters, poems, certificates, obituaries and drawings

did.unittitle: Alexander family history "copied from the catalogue of the officers and alumni of The Washington and Lee University...Historical Sketches"
Morris children school certificates and note, 1855 and n.d.

scopecontent.p: 6 school certificates; 1 small note with pressed flowers [G.W.M. to M.A.M. 1855?]
7 poems M.A.M. Oct. 14, 1838, Oct. 3, 1874, Feb. 28, 1879; E.M.C to M.A.M June 12, 1873; 4 n.d.
Programme of songs [presumably played at W.W.M.'s funeral]. Clipping taped to reverse side regarding W.W.M.'s post-mortem appointment to Major-General, and W.G.M.'s appointment as Major.

did.unittitle: List of items lost in fire, Feb. 8, 1831

scopecontent.p: 1 inventory of items lost in fire Feb. 7, 1831

8 receipts A. [1779], May 5, 1801, [1802], Apr. 9, 1804; W.W. Morris Dec. 30, 1823; S. Forrester Oct. 31, 1848 payment to "Negro Interpreter" for service with Indians; H. Ritchie Aug. 16, 1854; M.A.M. May 10, 1866
1 bequest of Perth Amboy Aug. 23, 1855
1 report detailing Indian battle in Florida Nov. 26, 1836
1 printed report Indian wars Feb. 16, 1842
1 page describing (with illustrations) various bullets

did.unittitle: William W. Morris military history, Feb. 19, 1869

scopecontent.p: 1 transcription of W.W.M.'s military history. Transcribed by M.A.M. Feb. 19, 1869 from the Adjutant General's office [E.D. Townsend]
3 clippings, 2.n.d.; I.O.O.F. speeches and ceremony report Sept. 21, 1865; W.G.M. career notices, n.d.
Miscellaneous calling cards given to the Morris and Carnochan families

3 locks of hair from M.A.M. and W.W.M.
Lewis Morris mortgage 1840; Gouverneur Morris deed 1843
3 copies M.A.M.'s will; 1 typed copy Oct. 1878; 2 written June 1878
List of taxes due on Ritchie lands; B. Boyett to M. Simpson Mar. 15, 1868
Poem transcription by young J.M.C.?
